topics.body:
What is the deal...with Net Neutrality?

Companies have not censored the internet yet, excepting cases where people were not paying or what have you.

It would just give the government precedence to regulate and censor the internet themselves. And in the wake of the NSA and IRS scandals that is a real possibility.

Moreover treating all internet traffic as equal will stop companies from investing in improving their networks, like Netflix recently did in a deal with Comcast.

Not saying the idea has no value but it sounds like running to the lions for safety to me.
topics.author: 4fe16df67f123b13e400003f

"@Whatevs":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/53ed75fb63687264fdc80100#post_53ed75fb63687264fdc80100
Some groups want net neutrality for greedy reasons, like how google wants it so as to save money, other small groups and companies don't want to get shafted.

Net neutrality isn't really that big of a deal.  Sometimes it's positive and sometimes it's negative.
